api manual¶

tabel

lightweight, intuitive and fast datatables
Design objective::
  • Data tabels with rows and columns, rows are numbered columns are named
  • Each column has its own datatype
  • Intuitive slicing, equivalent to standard Numpy and Python list
  • Limited features, focussing on tables and integrating with Numpy
tabel.T(datastruct)¶

Transposes

Parameters:datastruct – list, tuple containing lists or tuples with the data for each column or row
Returns:list containing lists with the data for each row or column
Return type:transposed datastruct
class tabel.Tabel(datastruct=None, columns=None, copy=True, inp_order='list_of_records')¶

Tabel class

T()¶

transposes a table

__getitem__(key)¶

key is one dimensional, r, the whole row at r will be returned key is two dimensional, (r,c), the 2d slice (r,c) will be returned r is an integer, integer iterable, a slice object, or a boolean iterable

c is an integer, integer iterable, slice object, boolean iterable,
string for column name or iterable of strings

“iterable” here is limited to list, tuple or numpy array

Returns:A table object containing the requested slice
__repr__()¶

pretty print using tabulate

__setitem__(key, value)¶

key is one dimensional, r, the whole row at r will be returned key is two dimensional, (r,c), the 2d slice (r,c) will be returned r is an integer, integer iterable, a slice object, or a boolean iterable

c is an integer, integer iterable, slice object, boolean iterable,
string for column name or iterable of strings
value can be any of:
a numpy array to set (a part of) a column a list of numpy arrays to set (part of) a number of columns a list or tuple of values to set a row for a number of columns a single value

If (r,c) refer to solely new columns, they are added and populated with value. For this r needs to be :, and value needs to be a single value or have the same length as the existing columns.

value and key must have matching dimensionality

Returns:nothing
add_column(datastruct, columns=None, copy=True)¶

Add a column to the table

Parameters:
  • - list, tuple, ndarray or dict containing lists, tuples or (datastruct) – ndarrays with the data for each column, or a pandas DataFrame
  • - list of column names, ignored when keys are part of the (columns) – datastruct, automatic names are generated if omitted.
append(tbl)¶

append table to self args —- tbl - a Tabel object or a datastruct that can be used to create one. columns on both Tabels needs to:

  1. match exactly
  2. match in names after reordering
  3. match in number and at least one of the tables has all integer strings for column names (they were autogenerated)
  4. do not match, but one of the tables has zero length
dict¶

output all data in dict format

save(filename, fmt='csv')¶

save to file args —-

filename - filename, should include path fmt - formatting, valid values are: csv, npz
values¶

get a row or a column of data whole columns wil be in array datatype, whole rows will be in tuple, single elements will be removed from the outer structure

tabel.read_tabel(filename, fmt='csv')¶

function to read data from disk and return a Tabel object

args filename - filename fmt - format specifier, supports: csv, npz, gz return Tabel object containing the data
